item.title: WD 8TB External Hard Drive Drops Back to $0.02 per GB, Now Cheaper Than 6TB Storage Capacity
item.content:encoded:
You can add a lot of extra storage to your computer without opening the case with the Western Digital 8TB Elements Desktop External Hard Drive. Photos, 4K video, game installs, and old project archives all take up valuable space on computers. This desktop-style external drive provides a spot to stash them. The WD Elements Desktop has a black enclosure designed to sit next to your computer tower or monitor, and its 8TB capacity will give you enough space to create several large backup systems and many large media folders. To begin moving files to the external drive, simply plug in the power and the included USB cable, and you’re done.

The Western Digital 8TB Elements Desktop External Hard Drive is available now at Amazon for $171, a $54 savings or 24% off the original price of $225.

An 8TB hard drive perfect for adding extra storage to your PC

The Western Digital 8TB Elements Desktop External Hard Drive is a USB hard drive that provides additional storage capacity for larger media collections and bigger project folders. WD claims that this version of the Elements Desktop offers faster data transfer speeds than previous models, so transferring large numbers of photos, 4K videos, or large game files should be easier and quicker. The Elements Desktop comes pre-formatted to work immediately with a Windows-based PC, but Mac users will have to format it before use.

Setting up the WD Elements Desktop model is easy and does not require much technical knowledge. Once connected to a Windows machine, the Elements Desktop is recognized immediately and can be used to store files after connecting the power and USB cables.

A compact desktop enclosure houses the internal mechanical hard drive in the WD Elements Desktop, and it does not take up much space, especially considering the amount of storage capacity it contains. The WD Elements Desktop is compact, which makes it easy to place beside a computer tower or monitor. The simple black design will blend in well with most computing environments, and the quiet passive operation makes it suitable for long-duration file transfers and scheduled backups.

If you are running out of internal storage space, then this 8TB Elements Desktop model is one of the easiest ways to add capacity to your computer. This hard drive can be used to store full system backups, serve as an archive for older projects, or store large media collections, such as videos and photos, that are taking up too much space on your internal drive. Now’s a great time to buy the WD Elements Desktop model, which is currently selling on Amazon for $171, a $54 savings from the $225 list price.
